titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arthur L. Dahl Papers , 1900-1939 JL022

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-03T16:34-0700

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Arthur L. Dahl held various positions in the United States Civil Service, among them personal secretary to Gifford Pinchot, who was then National Forester. Dahl was transferred to San Francisco in 1908 as Chief of Maintenance in the Bureau of Forestry District #5. By 1918 he had quit the civil service and was involved in the oil business.

chronitem.event: Becomes stenograher for George Wright, U.S. Indian Inspector for Indian Territory at Muscogee.
Passes Civil Service Stenographer and Typewriter test.
Bureau of Forestry, Department of Agriculture as Clerk, Stenographer and Typewriter. Becomes personal secretary of Gifford Pinchot.
Graduated with Bachelor of Laws degree from George Washington University.
Involved in oil - member of Santa Paula Oil Association, Secretary of Willard Canyon Oil Co., Director of Climax Oil Co.
With Life Department of the Aetna Life Insurance Co.
Appointed Secretary and returns to former work as Pacific Coast correspondent and representative of several trade publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection, which was given by his son, consists of some correspondence and documents relating to his early civil service jobs, his oil associations and his position with the Insurance Broker's Exchange. However, the great majority of the collection is lists and copies of articles that Dahl had published in various magazines and other periodicals between 1910 and 1937. Writing was a profitable hobby, at which he spent his spare hours from his business career. The articles range from highly technical articles about agricultural machines and methods to anecdotes with morals. In some cases the entire periodical, in which an article by Dahl is reproduced, has been preserved, and they provide interesting and rare reading material. A Good example of this is the issues of Grit dated from 1916 to 1925.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Arthur L. Dahl Papers . JL022. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Arthur L. Dahl, Jr. to the Jackson Library of Business, 1972. Transferred to Special Collections in 1979.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Forest Service--Officials and employees.
controlaccess.subject: Business records.
Petroleum industry and trade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains letters to and from Congressman and other government bureaucrats concerning changes in Dahl's job (switches position, agency or Department).

did.unittitle: Oil Stock: Willard Canyon Co., Kimerick Co. and Santa Paula Oil Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains stock certificates, correspondence and contracts concerning these three companies. Dahl was an officer (Secretary) of Willard and Santa Paula.

did.unittitle: Albert E. Boynton and Wendell C. Hammon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a biography of Boynton written by Dahl; and memorandums, written by Dahl, noting that he had served as a witness to the wills of both of these men, who were business associates (oil) and friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles giving a brief biography of Dahl upon the occasion of his appointment as Secretary of the Exchange; then one letter and clippings of articles regarding his resignation from that same position.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a handwritten list of articles found in the bound volumes: JL022 Box 1 Folders 2 - 3.

did.unittitle: Copy of Correspondence concerning article titled VICTORY DOCK SEAMEN
Original and Carbon Copies of Submitted Articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Most of these articles were rejected by publishers, N.D.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes diffferent articles and brochures written by Dahl about evaporated vegetables, and correspondence from E. Clemens Horst about the articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Folder containg about ten articles from different magazines on vastly different subjects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains various articles, the majority of which are about Forestry and Agriculture in various magazines (including Scientific American, American Thresherman, and Farm Power,etc.). Arranged in groups of same magazine, chronologically within each group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contents and manner of arrangement greatly similar to JL022 Box # 2. Different periodicals included: Pacific Ports, Automatic World, Tractor and Gas Engine Review, Grit, The Independent, Masonite Publications, etc. Dates: 1917 - 1937.

did.unittitle: Various Magazine Issues with Articles by Arthur Dahl

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contents vary but predominantly the articles are concerned with agricultural and technical topics. Periodicals: Technical World, Overland Monthly, Munsey's Magazine, Masonite Publications, etc. Dates range: 1911 July - 1936 Dec. Note: Overland Monthly - 1923 July contains: 1. Eulogy of Jane Lathrop Stanford and 2. an article about the Hoover Library, neither written by Dahl.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various issues with articles by Dahl.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including N.Y. Times, L.A. Times and others with articles by Dahl.
